popup.title: Time for a Quick Break!
popup.message: It looks like you've been focusing intensely on Machine Learning!  Take a short break to refresh your mind before diving back in.  You've got this!
popup.fun_fact: Did you know that the first self-learning program, written in 1952, was able to learn to play checkers better than its creator?

recommendation.title: Machine Learning for Beginners - A Simple Explanation

popup.fun_fact: Did you know that the first computer bug was literally a bug – a moth found trapped in a relay of the Harvard Mark II computer in 1947?

popup.title: Time for a Quick Break!
popup.message: It looks like you've been focusing on Machine Learning for a while.  Let's give your brain a short rest before diving back in! Take a few minutes to relax, then return refreshed and ready to learn.
popup.fun_fact: Did you know that the first self-learning algorithm was created in 1959 by Arthur Samuel? It was a checkers-playing program that learned from its mistakes, paving the way for modern AI!
